message: i just realized when setting up Fabric for a new project that it was 1.0 now but i still had to add in http://markpasc.typepad.com/blog/2010/04/loading-ssh-config-settings-for-fabric.html to get config support
i know it's all intertwingled with paramiko so i'm not really surprised, just want to make sure i'm not missing a .fabricrc option for turning it on or something
it looks like 1.0 doesn't support using your ssh config, such as the keys or default username you may have configured in ~/.ssh/config. is that right?
at some point i got the idea that was planned for 1.0, but i didn't note where so i may have imagined it anyway.
You're not missing anything. It's in a patch waiting atm, it'd also be in the docs if it was able to do that.

Yea, when in doubt, just look a the "Changes" pages on the docs, they list every change added in each version. Or as @morganiangoose said, just look around in the rest of the docs to see if it's mentioned. If not, probably not in :)
@bitprophet totally, thanks! i did look to see if it was in 1.0's changes, but it's harder to confirm absence than presence.
@markpasc No arguing there. The other way to check is to search code.fabfile.org, though that's also not perfect because (like any search) you have to know what terms to use.
